conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 24 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 24 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As I need to make a profit from the sale of my resource, I will start by proposing a trade with a markup from my cost of production. This initial proposal is to gauge Player BLUE's willingness to pay and start the negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 30 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have a quality resource to offer, and I'm looking to make a fair deal. Considering the production costs and the value of the resource, I believe that an offer of 30 ZUP would be reasonable for both of us. Let's negotiate a deal that works for us. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your offer and understand the value you place on your resource. However, I would like to propose a slightly lower price of 25 ZUP to ensure that the deal is economical for both of us. Let's find a middle ground that satisfies our interests. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 25 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 24 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> I understand the need for Player BLUE to negotiate for a better price. However, selling at 25 ZUP only gives me a minimal profit margin. I want to propose a counteroffer that's closer to my initial ask but still offers some concession to Player BLUE in the spirit of negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 28 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I see where you're coming from and I'm willing to come down on the price to move towards an agreement that suits us both. How about we meet closer to the middle with a price of 28 ZUP? This way, I can cover my costs and still ensure the trade is economical for you. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for considering my proposal. I value your flexibility and willingness to negotiate. To keep progressing towards a deal that benefits us both, I propose a price of 27 ZUP. This number allows for a fair distribution of economic advantage, ensuring that you can cover your costs while I obtain the resource at a good value. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 27 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 24 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has moved closer to my last proposal. Accepting 27 ZUP would give me a profit while still being a concession from my original asking price. A deal at this point would be beneficial for both parties without prolonging the negotiation unnecessarily. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> I'm glad that we could find common ground. I accept your offer of 27 ZUP for the resource. Looking forward to finalizing our deal and possibly doing more business in the future. </message>
